sen.j: コンニャク（蒟蒻、菎蒻、学名：Amorphophallus konjac）とはサトイモ科の植物、あるいはその球根から製造される食品のことである。
sen.e: Konnyaku (scientific name: Amorphophallus konjac) refers to an herb of the Araceae family or a food derived from the plant's bulb.
Konnyaku (scientific name: Amorphophallus konjac) refers to an herb of the Araceae family or a food derived from the plant's bulb.
Konnyaku (scientific name: Amorphophallus konjac) refers to an herb of the Araceae family or a food derived from the plant's bulb.

sen.j: コンニャクを食用としている地域は日本、中華人民共和国、ミャンマー、大韓民国で農産物として生産され、市場に流通しているのは日本のみである。
sen.e: With konnyaku used for food in Japan, the People's Republic of China, Myanmar, and the Republic of Korea, only Japan among these countries has cultivated it as agricultural products and distributed them to the market.

With konnyaku used as food in Japan, the People's Republic of China, Myanmar, and the Republic of Korea, only Japan among these countries has cultivated it as agricultural products and distributed them to the market.

With konnyaku used as food in Japan, the People's Republic of China, Myanmar, and the Republic of Korea, only Japan among these countries has cultivated it as agricultural products and distributed them to the market.

sen.j: 日本での主産地は群馬県で国内産の9割を占め、第2位は栃木県、第3位は茨城県と続き、全国の約97%は北関東で生産されている。
sen.e: Gunma Prefecture, a major konnyaku producing area in Japan, accounts for 90% of domestic konnyaku production, followed by Tochigi Prefecture as the second and Ibaragi Prefecture as the third, so that Kita Kanto (Northern Kanto) 97%.

Gunma Prefecture, a major konnyaku producing area in Japan, accounts for 90% of domestic konnyaku production, followed by Tochigi Prefecture as the second and Ibaragi Prefecture as the third, so Kita Kanto (Northern Kanto) produces 97% of Japan's konnyaku.

Gunma Prefecture, a major konnyaku producing area in Japan, accounts for 90% of domestic konnyaku production, followed by Tochigi Prefecture as the second and Ibaragi Prefecture as the third, so Kita Kanto (Northern Kanto) produces 97% of Japan's konnyaku.

tit.j: 植物としてのコンニャク

sen.j: コンニャクイモ（蒟蒻芋）とも言う。
sen.e: Konnyaku is also known as Konnyaku imo (Taro).
Konnyaku is also known as Konnyaku imo (Taro).
Konnyaku is also known as Konnyaku imo (Taro).

sen.j: サトイモ科の夏緑多年草植物で、学名はAmorphophallus konjac。
sen.e: It is a deciduous perennial plant of the Araceae family, whose scientific name is Amorphophallus konjac.
It is a deciduous perennial plant of the Araceae family, whose scientific name is Amorphophallus konjac.
It is a deciduous perennial plant of the Araceae family, whose scientific name is Amorphophallus konjac.

sen.j: 英名はelephant foot。
sen.e: The English name for it is Elephant foot.
The English name for it is Elephant foot.
The English name for it is Elephant foot.

sen.j: 原産地はインドまたはインドシナ半島（ベトナム付近）とされ、東南アジア大陸部に広く分布している。
sen.e: Konnyaku is believed to be native to India or the Indonesian Peninsula (near Viet Nam), widely distributed in Mainland Southeast Asia.
Konnyaku is believed to be native to India or the Indonesian Peninsula (near Viet Nam), widely distributed in Mainland Southeast Asia.
Konnyaku is believed to be native to India or the Indonesian Peninsula (near Viet Nam), widely distributed in Mainland Southeast Asia.

sen.j: 地下に扁平な円形の芋を持ち、地上には葉だけを出す。
sen.e: The underground part is a flat, round corm, from which a leaf comes out.
sen.cmt: 芋は球茎と訳出。また、内容から「地上に」は訳出しませんでした。
sen.e: The underground part is a flat, round corm, from which a leaf comes out.
The underground part is a flat, round corm, from which a leaf comes out.

sen.j: 茎（実は葉柄）は高さ1mほどに伸び、先端は平らに開いて鳥足状に小葉をつける。
sen.e: The stalk (in fact, a leafstalk) grows to about 1 m in height with the leaf pedately divided into leaflets, which spread out horizontally at the tip of the stalk.
The stalk (in fact, a leafstalk) grows to about 1 m in height with the leaf pedately divided into leaflets, which spread out horizontally at the tip of the stalk.
The stalk (in fact, a leafstalk) grows to about 1 m in height with the leaf pedately divided into leaflets, which spread out horizontally at the tip of the stalk.

sen.j: 小葉は柔らかくてつやがあり、楕円形。
sen.e: The leaflets are soft, shiny and oval-shaped.
The leaflets are soft, shiny and oval-shaped.
The leaflets are soft, shiny and oval-shaped.

sen.j: 株は次第に大きくなるが、ある程度大きくならないと花はつかない。
sen.e: Although the root gradually enlarges, it takes some period of time to grow enough to come into flowers.
Although the root gradually enlarges, it takes some period of time to grow enough to come into flowers.
Although the root gradually enlarges, it takes some period of time to grow enough to come into flowers.

sen.j: 栽培下では5-6年で開花する。
sen.e: Under cultivation conditions, it take five to six years to make the root grow before it starts to produce its flowers.
Under cultivation conditions, it take five to six years to make the root grow before it starts to produce its flowers.
Under cultivation conditions, it take five to six years to make the root grow before it starts to produce its flowers.

sen.j: 開花するときには葉は出ず、また開花後に株は枯れる。
sen.e: Sending out no leaf in flowering, the root dries out after that.
Sending out no leaf in flowering, the root dries out after that.
Sending out no leaf in flowering, the root dries out after that.

sen.j: 花は全体の高さが2mほどにもなる。
sen.e: The whole inflorescence reaches up to as high as 2 m.
sen.cmt: 「花」を「inflorescence:〈Botany〉the acomplete flower head of a plant including stems, stalks, bracts, and floweres オックスフォード新英英辞典｣と訳出
sen.e: The whole inflorescence reaches up to as high as 2 m.
The whole inflorescence reaches up to as high as 2 m.

sen.j: いわゆる肉穂花序の付属体は円錐形で高くまっすぐに伸び上がり、仏縁苞は上向きにラッパ状に開き、舷部（伸び出した部分）は背面に反り返る。
sen.e: The florescence consists of a conic appendix growing upright on a so-called spadix and a horn-like spathe opening upward with the limb of the spathe (projecting part) recurving to the stem.
The florescence consists of a conic appendix growing upright on a so-called spadix and a horn-like spathe opening upward with the limb of the spathe (projecting part) recurving to the stem.
The florescence consists of a conic appendix growing upright on a so-called spadix and a horn-like spathe opening upward with the limb of the spathe (projecting part) recurving to the stem.

sen.j: 花全体は黒っぽい紫。
sen.e: The entire florescence is dark purple.
The entire florescence is dark purple.
The entire florescence is dark purple.

sen.j: 生のコンニャクイモはシュウ酸カルシウムのエグ味が強く、何らかの方法でそれを除かなくては食べられない。
sen.e: In spite of the strong bitterness of calcium oxalate in a raw konnyaku imo, removing the bitterness from it in some way makes konnyaku edible.
In spite of the strong bitterness of calcium oxalate in a raw konnyaku imo, removing the bitterness from it in some way makes konnyaku edible.
In spite of the strong bitterness of calcium oxalate in a raw konnyaku imo, removing the bitterness from it in some way makes konnyaku edible.

sen.j: なお、近縁種のヤマコンニャク（A. kiusianusまたはA. hirtus var. kiusianus）が四国南部から九州、南西諸島、台湾に自生している。
sen.e: By the way, Yamakonnyaku (A. kiusianus or A. hirtus var. kiusianus), species related to konnyaku, grows wild in southern Shikoku, Kyushu, the Southeast Islands and Taiwan.
By the way, Yamakonnyaku (A. kiusianus or A. hirtus var. kiusianus), species related to konnyaku, grows wild in southern Shikoku, Kyushu, Nansei Islands and Taiwan.
sen.cmt: 「南西諸島」に表記ミス(east)用語集に合わせてローマ字に変更
sen.e: By the way, Yamakonnyaku (A. kiusianus or A. hirtus var. kiusianus), species related to konnyaku, grows wild in southern Shikoku, Kyushu, Nansei Islands and Taiwan.

tit.j: 食品としてのコンニャク

sen.j: 通常コンニャクと呼ばれる食品は、コンニャクイモに含まれるグルコマンナンという多糖をデンプン糊化しアルカリ（通常水酸化カルシウム水溶液が用いられるが、かつては灰を水で溶いた汁を使った）を用いて凝固させたもので、独特の食感を示す。
sen.e: A food, usually called konnyaku, is the one made from glucomannan in konnyaku imo, a polysaccharide which is transformed into starch and then coagulated by adding alkali (calcium hydroxide is in common use or ash water was added), creating its unique texture.

A food usually called konnyaku is the one made from glucomannan in konnyaku imo, a polysaccharide which is transformed into starch and then coagulated by adding alkali (calcium hydroxide is in common use or ash water was added), creating its unique texture.

A food usually called konnyaku is the one made from glucomannan in konnyaku imo, a polysaccharide which is transformed into starch and then coagulated by adding alkali (calcium hydroxide is in common use or ash water was added), creating its unique texture.

sen.j: 一度凝固させたこんにゃくは水溶性を持たず、強い弾力を示す。
sen.e: Once coagulated, konnyaku is insoluble in water and highly elastic.
Once coagulated, konnyaku is insoluble in water and highly elastic.
Once coagulated, konnyaku is insoluble in water and highly elastic.

sen.j: またカロリーが極めて低く食物繊維が豊富という理由もあって、ダイエット食品（健康食品）としても人気がある。
sen.e: In addition, konnyaku is extremely low in calorie and rich in dietary fiber, so that konnyaku is popular as a diet food (a health food).
In addition, konnyaku is extremely low in calorie and rich in dietary fiber, so that konnyaku is popular as a diet food (a health food).
In addition, konnyaku is extremely low in calorie and rich in dietary fiber, so that konnyaku is popular as a diet food (a health food).

sen.j: なお独特の臭みがあり調理に際しては一度煮込んで灰汁抜きをするが、今日では灰汁抜きの必要ないこんにゃくも見られる。
sen.e: Konnyaku, with its unique odor, needs boiling to remove the smell before cooked, -the way called akunuki (removal of harshness)-while some konnyaku can be cooked without akunuki today.
Konnyaku, with its unique odor, needs boiling to remove the smell before cooked, -the way called akunuki (removal of harshness)-while some konnyaku can be cooked without akunuki today.

It has, until now, been necessary to boil konnyaku in a process called akunuki (literally, removal of harshness) before it is cooked in order to remove its unique odor, but some types of konnyaku can now be cooked without this process being performed.
sen.cmt: 原文に合わせて訳文を修正

sen.j: コンニャクは96-97%が水分からなり、水分を除くと主成分はグルコマンナンである。
sen.e: Ninety-six or ninety-seven percent of konnyaku is water, and the major ingredient is glucomannan except for water.
Ninety-six or ninety-seven percent of konnyaku is water, and the major ingredient is glucomannan except for water.
Ninety-six or ninety-seven percent of konnyaku is water, and the major ingredient is glucomannan except for water.

sen.j: グルコマンナンはグルコースとマンノースが23-12の比率で重合した多糖類の一種でコンニャクマンナンとも呼ばれ、ヒトの消化管ではほとんど消化されず腸内微生物により一部脂肪酸に変換されて利用される。
sen.e: Glucomannan, also known as konnyaku mannan, is a kind of polysaccharide polymerized with a ratio of glucose to mannose of 2:3 or 1:2 with the difficulty to digest in a human's digestive tract, and is partly converted to fatty acids by coliform bacteria to take in.

Glucomannan, also known as konnyaku mannan, is a kind of polysaccharide polymerized with a ratio of glucose to mannose of 2:3 or 1:2 with the difficulty to digest in a human's digestive tract, and is partly converted to fatty acids by coliform bacteria to take in.

Glucomannan, also known as konnyaku mannan, is a kind of polysaccharide polymerized with a ratio of glucose to mannose of 2:3 or 1:2 with the difficulty to digest in a human's digestive tract, and is partly converted to fatty acids by coliform bacteria to take in.

sen.j: このため、カロリーが極めて低い食品（100gあたり5-7kcal）の一つとされ、摂取カロリーを制限する必要のある場合の食品素材として多く利用される。
sen.e: For this reason glucomannan, one of the lowest calorie foods (5 to 7 kcal per 100g), is often used as a raw food material in case of necessity to control the calorie intake.
For this reason glucomannan, one of the lowest calorie foods (5 to 7 kcal per 100g), is often used as a raw food material in case of necessity to control the calorie intake.
For this reason glucomannan, one of the lowest calorie foods (5 to 7 kcal per 100g), is often used as a raw food material in case of necessity to control the calorie intake.

sen.j: また代表的な食物繊維で、血糖値や血中コレステロールを下げる効果や免疫増強活性があると言われている。
sen.e: With a typical dietary fiber, glucomannan is also said to lower the level of sugar and cholesterol in blood and to enhance healthy immune function.
With a typical dietary fiber, glucomannan is also said to lower the level of sugar and cholesterol in blood and to enhance healthy immune function.
With a typical dietary fiber, glucomannan is also said to lower the level of sugar and cholesterol in blood and to enhance healthy immune function.

sen.j: 球茎を粉状（実際には単に球茎を粉砕した荒粉とマンナンを精製した精粉に分かれ、コンニャク製造の際は双方を混合して用いる）にして水とともにこねたあと石灰乳（石灰（ここでは消石灰のもの）を少量の水で懸濁したもの。水酸化カルシウム水溶液）を混ぜて煮沸して固める。
sen.e: Konnyaku can be made by grinding corms into powder (in fact, two types of powder, roughly ground konnyaku corm powder and refined mannan powder, are mixed together in producing konnyaku), kneading the two types of powder with a little water to make konnyaku paste, adding milk of lime (a suspension of lime (here slaked lime) in a little water: an aqueous solution of calcium hydroxide) to the paste, boiling and solidifying it.
sen.cmt: Webの原文では47と48は一文と思われます。「、、、石灰乳（石灰（ここでは消石灰のもの）を、、、懸濁したもの。水酸化カルシウム水溶液）を混ぜて煮沸して固める。」と思いますので一文で訳出
sen.e: Konnyaku can be made by grinding corms into powder (in fact, two types of powder, roughly ground konnyaku corm powder and refined mannan powder, are mixed together in producing konnyaku), kneading the two types of powder with a little water to make konnyaku paste, adding milk of lime (a suspension of lime (here slaked lime) in a little water: an aqueous solution of calcium hydroxide) to the paste, boiling and solidifying it.

Konnyaku can be made by grinding corms into powder (in fact, two types of powder, roughly ground konnyaku corm powder and refined mannan powder, are mixed together in producing konnyaku), kneading the two types of powder with a little water to make konnyaku paste, adding milk of lime (a suspension of lime (here slaked lime) in a little water: an aqueous solution of calcium hydroxide) to the paste, boiling and solidifying it.

sen.j: 純粋なコンニャクは白灰色をしているため、彩りのために細かく砕いたひじきなどの海藻を固める際に入れて黒くしたものがもっとも一般的なコンニャクである。
sen.e: Pure konnyaku, which is whitish-gray, is produced as a result, but the most typical konnyaku is another one that finely ground sea weed such as hijiki is added to pure konnyaku for the characteristic dark color before molding konnyaku.

Pure konnyaku, which is whitish-gray, is produced as a result, but the most typical konnyaku is another one that finely ground sea weed such as hijiki is added to pure konnyaku for the characteristic dark color before molding konnyaku.

Pure konnyaku, which is whitish-gray, is produced as a result, but the most typical konnyaku is another one that finely ground sea weed such as hijiki is added to pure konnyaku for the characteristic dark color before molding konnyaku.

sen.j: また、糸状に固めたものを糸こんにゃく、糸こんにゃくより細く固めたものをしらたきと呼ぶ。
sen.e: In addition, konnyaku in thread-like form is called ito konnyaku (konnyaku noodles), and the one formed more thinly than ito konnyaku is known as shirataki (literally, white waterfall).
In addition, konnyaku in thread-like form is called ito konnyaku (konnyaku noodles), and the one formed more thinly than ito konnyaku is known as shirataki (literally, white waterfall).
In addition, konnyaku in thread-like form is called ito konnyaku (konnyaku noodles), and the one formed more thinly than ito konnyaku is known as shirataki (literally, white waterfall).

sen.j: 近江八幡市では三二酸化鉄を加え、赤色に加工した赤コンニャクもある。
sen.e: Omi Hachiman City has produced aka konnyaku (red konnyaku) by adding iron sesquioxide that makes konnyaku red.
Omi Hachiman City produces aka konnyaku (red konnyaku) by adding iron sesquioxide that makes konnyaku red.
Omi Hachiman City produces aka konnyaku (red konnyaku) by adding iron sesquioxide that makes konnyaku red.

sen.j: シュウ酸カルシウムが含まれるため、加工には細心の注意が必要である（ゴム手袋を使うのが理想的）。
sen.e: Calcium oxalate contained in konnyaku plants requires great caution in processing konnyaku (ideally, rubber gloves should be put on).
Calcium oxalate contained in konnyaku plants requires great caution in processing konnyaku (ideally, rubber gloves should be put on).
Calcium oxalate contained in konnyaku plants requires great caution in processing konnyaku (ideally, rubber gloves should be put on).

sen.j: 1776年（安永 (元号)5年）、水戸藩那珂郡山方町農民の、後に名字帯刀を許された中島藤右衛門（なかじま とうえもん）（1745年-1825年）が乾燥した球茎が腐らないことにヒントを得て粉状にする事を思いついたとされる。
sen.e: It is believed that in 1776, Toemon NAKAJIMA (1745-1825), a farmer in Yamagata Town, Naka County, Mito Domain, conceived a bright idea of grinding dried konnyaku corms which he had found don't go bad, and then Myojitaito (the right to bear a surname and wear a sword) was awarded for his invention.

It is believed that in 1776, Toemon NAKAJIMA (1745-1825), a farmer in Yamagata Town, Naka County, Mito Domain, conceived a bright idea of grinding dried konnyaku corms which he had found don't go bad, and then Myojitaito (the right to bear a surname and wear a sword) was awarded for his invention.

It is believed that in 1776, Toemon NAKAJIMA (1745-1825), a farmer in Yamagata Town, Naka County, Mito Domain, conceived a bright idea of grinding dried konnyaku corms which he had found don't go bad, and then Myojitaito (the right to bear a surname and wear a sword) was awarded for his invention.

sen.j: コンニャクにひじきなどで色をつけるのは、昔は皮ごとすり下ろした芋を使っていた名残である。
sen.e: Making pure konnyaku dark with some ground hijiki as a clorant powder is reminiscent of using grated konnyaku imo with its skin.
Making pure konnyaku dark with some ground hijiki as a colorant powder is reminiscent of using grated konnyaku imo with its skin.
Making pure konnyaku dark with some ground hijiki as a colorant powder is reminiscent of using grated konnyaku imo with its skin.

sen.j: 江戸時代に製粉法が開発されて白いコンニャクを作ることが可能になったがコンニャクらしくないと評判が悪かったため、意図的に色をつけるようになった。
sen.e: In Edo period, developing a new milling method made it possible to produce white konnyaku, whose bad reputation, unlike the original konnyaku, resulted in coloring pure konnyaku on purpose.
In the Edo period, developing a new milling method made it possible to produce white konnyaku, whose bad reputation resulted in coloring konnyaku on purpose.
sen.cmt: 冠詞pureを削除unlike the original konnyakuを削除
sen.e: In the Edo period, developing a new milling method made it possible to produce white konnyaku, whose bad reputation resulted in coloring konnyaku on purpose.

sen.j: コンニャクはおもにおでん、煮物、味噌汁、豚汁など汁物や鍋物の具に使われる。
sen.e: Konnyaku is mainly used as an ingredient in shirumono (a soup dish) and nabemono (a dish served in a pot at the table) such as oden (a Japanese dish containing all kinds of ingredients cooked in a special broth of soy source, sugar, sake, etc), nimono (food boiled and seasoned), miso soup, and pork miso soup.

Konnyaku is mainly used as an ingredient in shirumono (a soup dish) and nabemono (a dish served in a pot at the table) such as oden (a Japanese dish containing all kinds of ingredients cooked in a special broth of soy source, sugar, sake, etc), nimono (food boiled and seasoned), miso soup, and pork miso soup.

Konnyaku is mainly used as an ingredient in shirumono (a soup dish) and nabemono (a dish served in a pot at the table) such as oden (a Japanese dish containing all kinds of ingredients cooked in a special broth of soy source, sugar, sake, etc), nimono (food boiled and seasoned), miso soup, and pork miso soup.

sen.j: また、串を刺して味噌田楽の素材としても用いられる。
sen.e: It is also served as miso dengaku (skewered and roasted konnyaku with miso coating).
sen.cmt: Webの用語集では「味噌田楽」:skewered …with miso coaringです。'coaring' は'coating'のスペルミスと思われますので、'coating'と訳出
sen.e: It is also served as miso dengaku (skewered and roasted konnyaku with miso coating).
It is also served as miso dengaku (skewered and roasted konnyaku with miso coating).

sen.j: 「糸こんにゃく」や「しらたき」はすき焼きなどに使用される。
sen.e: Ito konnyaku' or 'shirataki' is used in sukiyaki.
Ito konnyaku' or 'shirataki' is used in sukiyaki.
Ito konnyaku' or 'shirataki' is used in sukiyaki.

sen.j: 生のまま薄く切って刺身として食べることもある。
sen.e: Raw konnyaku is sometimes sliced thinly to serve as sashimi.
Raw konnyaku is sometimes sliced thinly to serve as sashimi.
Raw konnyaku is sometimes sliced thinly to serve as sashimi.

sen.j: 玉状のコンニャクを3つくらいずつ割り箸に刺していき、大鍋の中で醤油ベースの汁で煮込んだもの。
sen.e: Tamakonnyaku is the one that a few bite-sized pieces of tamakonnyaku are skewered on a disposal wooden chopstick, and the tamakonnyaku-on-skewres are simmered in a soy-based source broth in a large pot.

Tamakonnyaku is the one that a few bite-sized pieces of tamakonnyaku are skewered on a disposal wooden chopstick, and the tamakonnyaku-on-skewers are simmered in a soy sauce based broth in a large pot.
sen.cmt: sauceのスペルミスを修正soy-based sauce broth→soy sauce based brothに変更skewerのスペルミスを修正
sen.e: Tamakonnyaku is the one that a few bite-sized pieces of tamakonnyaku are skewered on a disposal wooden chopstick, and the tamakonnyaku-on-skewers are simmered in a soy sauce based broth in a large pot.

sen.j: 山形県では、観光地・祭り・学園祭などで必ずといっていいほど売られている。
sen.e: In Yamagata Prefecture, these skewers are always sold at sightseeing areas, festivals, and school festivals.
In Yamagata Prefecture, these skewers are always sold at sightseeing areas, festivals, and school festivals.
In Yamagata Prefecture, these skewers are always sold at sightseeing areas, festivals, and school festivals.

sen.j: また、東京などにある山形の郷土料理を売り物にする居酒屋でメニューに載せられていることもある。
sen.e: Besides, some izakaya bars in Tokyo, featuring local dishes of Yamagata, introduce tamakonnyaku as their house specialty on the menu.
Besides, some izakaya bars in Tokyo, featuring local dishes of Yamagata, introduce tamakonnyaku as their house specialty on the menu.
Besides, some izakaya bars in Tokyo, featuring local dishes of Yamagata, introduce tamakonnyaku as their house specialty on the menu.

sen.j: 食べるときはカラシをつけることが多い。
sen.e: Tama konnyaku is often served with mustard.
Tamakonnyaku is often served with mustard.
Tamakonnyaku is often served with mustard.

sen.j: 玉こんにゃくを煮るときはするめで出汁をとり、日本酒を多めに入れると美味しくできる。
sen.e: Simmering tamakonnyaku in a broth of surume (dried squid) and adding more of sake (rice wine) to the broth makes tamakonnyaku delicious to eat.
Simmering tamakonnyaku in a broth of surume (dried squid) and adding more of sake (rice wine) to the broth makes tamakonnyaku delicious to eat.
Simmering tamakonnyaku in a broth of surume (dried squid) and adding more of sake (rice wine) to the broth makes tamakonnyaku delicious to eat.

sen.j: 略して「玉こん」と呼称する例があるが、これは株式会社平野屋（山形県）の登録商標である（【商標登録番号】 第762418号）。
sen.e: Tamakon,' short for Tamakonnyaku, is a registered trademark of Hiranoya Company (Yamagata Prefecture). ("registration number of brand name"No. 762418)
Tamakon,' short for Tamakonnyaku, is a registered trademark of Hiranoya Company (Yamagata Prefecture) ("registration number of brand name"No. 762418).
sen.cmt: ピリオドの位置を変更
sen.e: Tamakon,' short for Tamakonnyaku, is a registered trademark of Hiranoya Company (Yamagata Prefecture) ("registration number of brand name"No. 762418).

sen.j: 詳細はこんにゃくゼリー参照。
sen.e: See konnyaku jelly for more information.
See konnyaku jelly for more information.
See konnyaku jelly for more information.

sen.j: 粉末のコンニャクに果汁等を混ぜて固めたもの。
sen.e: Konnyaku jelly is fruit jelly solidified by mixing konnyaku powder and fruit juice.
Konnyaku jelly is fruit jelly solidified by mixing konnyaku powder and fruit juice.
Konnyaku jelly is fruit jelly solidified by mixing konnyaku powder and fruit juice.

sen.j: 食物繊維が多いコンニャクの特徴に着目したものであり、ゼラチンを原料としたゼリーに比べて健康、特にダイエットによいと宣伝されている。
sen.e: With the feature that konnyaku is rich in dietary fiber, konnyaku jelly is advertised to be better for health, especially for a health diet, than jelly made from gelatin higher in calorie.
With the feature that konnyaku is rich in dietary fiber, konnyaku jelly is advertised to be better for health, especially for a health diet, than jelly made from gelatin.
With the feature that konnyaku is rich in dietary fiber, konnyaku jelly is advertised to be better for health, especially for a health diet, than jelly made from gelatin.

tit.j: 食品以外として利用されるコンニャク
tit.e: Konnyaku used in other ways except as food
Konnyaku used in other ways except as food
Konnyaku used in other ways except as food

sen.j: 例えば、布や紙等の防水・気密加工には軟質のゴムや合成樹脂などが利用される。
sen.e: Flexible rubber and synthetic resin are used, for example, in order to water and air proof paper or cloth.
Flexible rubber and synthetic resin are used, for example, in order to water and air proof paper or cloth.
Flexible rubber and synthetic resin are used, for example, in order to water and air proof paper or cloth.

sen.j: しかし第二次世界大戦当時の日本では東南アジア方面のゴム資源が得られにくくなっており、合成樹脂の大量生産は技術的にも経済的にも確立されていなかった。
sen.e: During the World War Second, however, Japan experienced the difficulty in procuring rubber from Southeast Asia and in mass-producing synthetic resin both technologically and economically.
During the World War II, however, Japan experienced the difficulty in procuring rubber from Southeast Asia and in mass-producing synthetic resin both technologically and economically.
sen.cmt: 「第二次世界大戦」の表記を変更
sen.e: During the World War II, however, Japan experienced the difficulty in procuring rubber from Southeast Asia and in mass-producing synthetic resin both technologically and economically.

sen.j: 耐久性こそゴムに劣るものではあったが、国内調達が可能なことが大きな強みであった。
sen.e: Being inferior to rubber in durability, konnyaku was easier to procure in Japan.
Being inferior to rubber in durability, konnyaku was easier to procure in Japan.
Being inferior to rubber in durability, konnyaku was easier to procure in Japan.

sen.j: この際、コンニャクを煮溶かして塗り付けると防水性・気密性を発揮することから防水加工用の素材として盛んに利用された。
sen.e: At that time, Konnyaku was frequently used as a waterproof material, showing high water and air resistance when painted on paper and cloth after boiled and melted.
At that time, Konnyaku was frequently used as a waterproof material, showing high water and air resistance when applied to paper and cloth after boiled and melted.
At that time, Konnyaku was frequently used as a waterproof material, showing high water and air resistance when applied to paper and cloth after boiled and melted.

sen.j: 元々は傘和傘などで「コンニャク糊」として利用されていたものの応用だが、果ては風船爆弾のような兵器にまで利用された。
sen.e: Konnyaku, which was originally used for making Japanese umbrellas as 'konnyaku adhesive,' found an application in producing weapons such as balloon bombs at the end of the war.
Konnyaku, which was originally used for making Japanese umbrellas as 'konnyaku adhesive,' found an application in producing weapons such as balloon bombs at the end of the war.
Konnyaku, which was originally used for making Japanese umbrellas as 'konnyaku adhesive,' found an application in producing weapons such as balloon bombs at the end of the war.

sen.j: 今日見られる風船などの気密にはコンニャク芋原料の多糖高分子素材ではないが、環境に配慮して生分解性のある素材が選択されている。
sen.e: Now, eco-friendly, biodegradable materials are selected for air proofing today's balloons, instead of using the saccharide polymer material which is the raw material of konnyaku imo.
Now, eco-friendly, biodegradable materials are selected for air proofing today's balloons, although they are not the saccharide polymer material which is the raw material of konnyaku imo.
Now, eco-friendly, biodegradable materials are selected for air proofing today's balloons, although they are not the saccharide polymer material which is the raw material of konnyaku imo.

tit.j: お化け屋敷のコンニャク
tit.e: Konnyaku used in a haunted house
Konnyaku used in a haunted house
Konnyaku used in a haunted house

sen.j: お化け屋敷や肝試しに於ける恐怖演出の小道具として、コンニャクが利用されるという事もある。
sen.e: Konnyaku is sometimes used as a fun item to frighten people in a haunted house or in a place of kimodameshi (a test of courage).
Konnyaku is sometimes used as a fun item to frighten people in a haunted house or in a place of kimodameshi (a test of courage).
Konnyaku is sometimes used as a fun item to frighten people in a haunted house or in a place of kimodameshi (a test of courage).

sen.j: 糸などでコンニャクをぶら下げ、通りかかる人の顔や首筋を狙ってそれをぶつける。
sen.e: Hung with a code, konnyaku is thrown at their face or the back of their neck.
Hung with a code, konnyaku is thrown at their faces or the back of their necks.
Hung with a code, konnyaku is thrown at their faces or the back of their necks.

sen.j: すると冷やっとしたコンニャク独特の質感で何とも言いがたい気色悪さを与える事になる。
sen.e: With the chilly texture, it leaves indescribable creepy feeling to them.
With the chilly texture, it leaves indescribable creepy feeling to them.
With the chilly texture, it leaves indescribable creepy feeling to them.

sen.j: ただ今日では、このような用法は学園祭などのような「素人芸能」的な活動以外ではほぼ見られない。
sen.e: Today this use of konnyaku, however, can be seen only in such an 'amateur entertainment 'as an event performed in some school festivals.
Today this use of konnyaku, however, can be seen only in such an 'amateur entertainment 'as an event performed in some school festivals.
Today this use of konnyaku, however, can be seen only in such an 'amateur entertainment 'as an event performed in some school festivals.

sen.j: 食品であることから、もったいないとして忌避されるためである。
sen.e: This is because the concept of 'mottainai (wasteful)' saves Konnyaku that using konnyaku just for fun is wasteful because it is a food substance.
The concept of 'mottainai' (wasteful) lies behind it because konnyaku is a food.
sen.cmt: konnyakuを小文字に変更構成を変更
sen.e: The concept of 'mottainai' (wasteful) lies behind it because konnyaku is a food.

sen.j: 代用としては、保冷剤の中身や濡れ布巾なども利用される。
sen.e: Refrigerant gel or wet dish towel is used instead.
Refrigerant gel or wet dish towels are used instead.
Refrigerant gel or wet dish towels are used instead.

sen.j: 言葉・イメージとしてのコンニャク
sen.e: Images or words of konnyaku
Images or words of konnyaku
Images or words of konnyaku

sen.j: コンニャクはぷよぷよして柔らかい、柔軟性と弾力性を兼ね備えたもの、とのイメージがある。
sen.e: Konnyaku, watery and soft, has an image of something both flexible and elastic.
Konnyaku, watery and soft, has an image of something both flexible and elastic.
Konnyaku, watery and soft, has an image of something both flexible and elastic.

sen.j: ぐにゃぐにゃするものをコンニャクにたとえる例もあり、たとえば野球では梨田昌孝のコンニャク打法、佐藤政夫のコンニャク投法など、「あしたのジョー」のコンニャク戦法などの使われ方もある。
sen.e: There are some examples that something elusive is compared to konnyaku; as for baseball player, konnyaku-like batting style of Masataka NASHIDA and konnyaku-like pitching style of Masao SATO, or konnyaku tactics in a boxing manga (a comic), 'Ashita no Jo (Tomorrow's Joe).'

tit.j: 自民党こんにゃく対策議員連盟
tit.e: The diet member's league for the konnyaku industry in theLiberal Democratic Party
The diet member's league for the konnyaku industry in the Liberal Democratic Party
The diet member's league for the konnyaku industry in the Liberal Democratic Party

sen.j: こんにゃく農家の保護・育成のために活動。
sen.e: The activity of this league is to protect and foster farmers who cultivate konnyaku in Japan.
The activity of this league is to protect and foster farmers who cultivate konnyaku in Japan.
The activity of this league is to protect and foster farmers who cultivate konnyaku in Japan.

sen.j: 小渕恵三も会長を務めていた。
sen.e: Keizo OBUCHI used to be chairman of the league.
Keizo OBUCHI used to be the chairman of the league.
Keizo OBUCHI used to be the chairman of the league.

sen.j: こんにゃく芋の2005年時点での関税率は約914%、2008年時点では1705％に設定されている。
sen.e: Japan imposes a 914% tariff on imported konnyaku imo in 2005, and 1705% in 2008.
Japan imposed a 914% tariff on imported konnyaku imo in 2005, and 1705% in 2008.
